intro: Monopsis scabra var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored monopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, typically featuring a white base with a deep purple or red upper lip. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
